did.unittitle: Jan Rowiński collection
did.abstract: Broadsides, flyers, and posters issued by Red Guards relating to the Chinese Cultural Revolution.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jan Rowiński collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2007.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born in the village of Kielpiny, in northern Poland
Studied Chinese language at the University of Beijing
Studied at the Diplomatic Institute, Beijing
Worked in the China Department of the Polish Foreign Ministry
Received an MA from the Main School of Foreign Service, Warsaw
Completed a PhD in the History of International Relations, Warsaw
Served as the II and then I Secretary of the Polish Embassy in Beijing
Conducted research and taught at the Polish Institute of International Relations, Warsaw
Served as the editor-in-chief of Problems of the Far East, quarterly publication of the Polish Academy of Sciences
Completed a Habilitacja (post PhD) in Political Science, Warsaw
Served in the Foreign Ministry, research and planning deprtment
Served in the Polish embassy in Beijing (as deputy ambassador, minister)
Worked as a professor of political science at University of Warsaw, and in the Institute of International Relations

Retired after a long career of writing: 250 essays and articles, and several monographs, including 4 volumes on the Cultural Revolution and 17 volumes on Chinese foreign policy during from 1949 to 1985

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Broadsides, flyers, and posters issued by Red Guards relating to the Chinese Cultural Revolution.

The force at the core leading our cause forward is the Chinese Communist Party. The theoretical basis guiding our thinking is Marxism-Leninism. Mao Zedong. Not only must we have a powerful regular army, we must also organize contingents of the people's militia on a big scale. This will make it difficult for the imperialists to move a single inch in our country in the event of invasion. Mao Zedong.
